title: Determination of Flight Paths of an SBD-1 Airplane in Simulated Diving Attacks, Special Report

organization.name: National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics. Langley Aeronautical Lab.

abstract: An investigation has been made to determine the motions of and the flight paths describe by a Navy dive-bombing airplane in simulated diving attacks. The data necessary to evaluate these items, with the exception of the atmospheric wind data, were obtained from automatic recording instruments installed entirely within the airplane. The atmospheric wind data were obtained from the ground by the balloon-theodolite method. The results of typical dives at various dive angles are presented in the form of time histories of the motion of the airplane as well as flight paths calculated with respect to still air and with respect to the ground.
